intro: Stenodraba, commonly known as the sand sedge, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. These plants are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Stenodraba species are characterized by their grass-like appearance, with narrow leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. They are generally low-growing and form dense mats, which help stabilize sandy soils. The genus includes several species, many of which are adapted to extreme environmental conditions.
